qas.question: What happens if a Cardinal is named in pectore, and the pope dies?

plausible_answers.text: pope judges it safe to make the appointment public, he may do so at any time

qas.question: What does the Pope do if conditions do not change?
What happens if a Cardinal is named in pectore and the president dies?
Whose identity is not revealed if the pope dies?
Who ranks secondary to those raised in the cardinalate at the time of his appointment?

context: If conditions change, so that the <b1_0>pope judges it safe to make the appointment public, he may do so at any time<b1_0/>. The cardinal in question then ranks in precedence with those raised to the cardinalate at the time of his <b3_0><b4_0>in pectore<b4_0/><b3_0/> appointment. If a pope dies before revealing the identity of an in pectore cardinal, <a0_0><b2_0>the cardinalate expires<a0_0/>.
